MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: This is a scary story that really happened.
Recently, there has been very creepy gossip going around among the SSS.

When you look in the hallway on the first floor of the student dormitory at exactly 2 a.m., you will see a doll walking alone...She calls out and says, "I am Laika," walks to the front door, and then disappears.

At first, the story was that it was a malicious hoax, but the situation took a sudden turn when Ohana, the housemother who was making her midnight rounds, testified that she had actually seen the doll. An investigation team was formed within the SSS and an investigation was conducted.
So I decided to talk to someone who knows a lot about dolls.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: If you want to know about dolls, just ask me. I'm Shimoamazu, the first disciple of Ooenomiya, the guardian of Ooe. My recent obsession is collecting Nishiki dolls that grow long hair. It's a special spell. I'm mainly good at sealing spells.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
And well, I'm happy to go along with the usual song and dance.
What exactly do you want me to do when it comes to research?

You know the doll, right, Shimoamazu?
You know the story of the creepy doll that walks around alone at night...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
What's so creepy about a doll walking around by itself?
Besides, dolls that can speak aren't that rare.

No, it's creepy and it's weird.
Otherwise, there wouldn't be such a fuss.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Well, people who don't have regular contact with dolls
might be surprised by an accident of this magnitude.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I heard some of the girls were so scared, they asked for permission to stay out for an extended period of time.

Oh, I'm sure that's Yakutsk. I didn't give her permission, of course.
She's staying in Yoshino's room now.

Leaving aside Yakutsk, who is freaked out without seeing the real thing, Ohana's testimony that she actually saw a talking doll can't be overlooked. She said she was absolutely sure it wasn't a hallucination or a mistake.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's surprising that the housemother would say that. I can't believe she would deny the possibility that she was sleepwalking or that it was a ghost.
I think that's probably because she felt a response.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: A response?

Ohana thought the doll was suspicious
and kicked it from behind with a flying knee.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Oh my, poor thing! And she's alright?
The doll, of course!

To her surprise, it was completely unharmed. Of course, Ohana took it easy on her, but she said she kicked her so hard that she would have gone into the wall if she were human. Ohana made the first attack, but there's something about the aura that seems to be strong.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Still, I don't think anyone should attack it without question. We have to be careful with our children. It would be awful if they attacked us just because we were walking around.
Shimoamazu lets out one sigh and talks to the doll she is holding under her arm.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: ...You think so, too, don't you, Laika?
...What?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Isn't she cute? She's Laika, the St. Iris doll I recently got.
I picked her up when Amano and I were taking a walk in the woods.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Come on, say hello to Conductor.
I'm Laika.
Hey, hey, hey...

Hey, hey, hey! That's her. She's the one!
She walks, she talks, and then she disappears. It's Laika!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Oh, so this is the doll you've been talking about? Then don't worry.
I'll cast a strong spell on Laika to prevent her from doing anything bad.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Isn't that right, Laika?
I'm Laika!
Eh? Oww...Laika hit me. Huh? Is this really okay?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's just a little flirtation because she knows you.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Come on, Laika. Let's go back to your room, okay?
And if you see someone named Ohana, run away, okay?
I'm Laika.
In this way, the horrific doll incident was resolved as a case of poor management by Shimoamazu, and peace was restored to the dormitory.
